RandomProblem.title: Random Challenge
RandomProblem.description: A random cipher text to be deciphered by you.

ProblemCode.title: Challenge Code
ProblemCode.description: Enter code for a specific challenge.

Frequency.title: Frequency
Frequency.tooltip: Investigate the relative frequency of letters in the cipher text.
Frequency.explanationBody: The frequency analysis tool displays the relative frequency of all characters in the cipher text. When comparing with the expected relative frequency, this might give some clues how the characters are changed.<0/>Changing the <1>stride</1> gives you the relative frequencies with the text strided by the given value. Use the buttons at the bottom to navigate through different positions in the stride.

Friedman.title: Friedman
Friedman.tooltip: Investigate the friedman characteristic of the cipher text considering different key length.
Friedman.explanationBody: The friedman analysis tool displays the friedman characteristic in the text considering different possible key lengths. Comparing it with the expected characteristic might let you deduce the the key length if it is encrypted with vignere.<0/>Change the <1>key length</1> to change the max key length considered.

Kasiski.title: Kasiski
Kasiski.tooltip: Investigate repeated segments in the ciphertext.
Kasiski.NoteGrey: Grey characters are part of multiple segments.
Kasiski.explanationBody: The kasiski analysis searches for all repeated text segments of a specific length and marks them. Click on them to find out more information about these repeated segments. Their position might reveal some information about the key.

Table.title: Table
Table.tooltip: Display the cipher text in a table.
Table.NotePink?: Pink <0>?</0> indicate empty positions in the table.
Table.explanationBody: The table analysis shows you the cipher text in a table. In that table, the text is filled in column by column. Maybe you can start reading the text if you get the dimensions correct.

Substitution.title: Substitution
Substitution.tooltip: Replace different letters of the alphabet and see the changes in the text.
Substitution.explanationBody: The substitution analysis lets you replace letters in the alphabet and see the changes in the text. Maybe this helps you revert a substitution cipher.<0/>Note that the key you work out here is the inverse of the actual substitution key.
